html: Versailles, MO vs. Versailles, France. Milan, MO vs. Milan, Italy. Sedalia, MO vs. Sedalia, Canada. One thing all these cities have in common? The cost of prescription drugs is, on average, consistently higher– up to 591% higher – in the Show Me state than in foreign countries.pic.twitter.com/JEgrAZ5uzR

html: This bill would allow widows, widowers & surviving divorced spouses to: receive 100% of the survivor benefits they are entitled to increase the value of their survivor benefits beyond arbitrary caps receive child in-care benefits until children are 18 or 19 & more
text:
This bill would allow widows, widowers & surviving divorced spouses to:
receive 100% of the survivor benefits they are entitled to
increase the value of their survivor benefits beyond arbitrary caps
receive child in-care benefits until children are 18 or 19 & more

html: This week, Claire introduced a bill to honor Arla Harrell—a Missouri WWII veteran intentionally exposed to mustard gas—by renaming the post office in Macon, MO the Arla W. Harrell Post Office. After a 2 year effort, Claire’s Arla Harrell Act was signed by the President last year.

html: 7 years ago, Claire heard about problems with care at a VA medical center in St. Louis – so she created a ‘secret shopper’ program to allow veterans to share timely, confidential feedback about their care.

html: Claire: “The era of Members of Congress controlling the secrecy of harassment claims with no accountability & a difficult path to justice for victims is over. If the folks who represent you are found guilty of harassment, they should be responsible, & you should know about it.”

html: She’s proud to back a new bipartisan plan to: 1. support local and statewide prevention efforts 2. improve detection and seizures of illegal shipments of fentanyl 3. allow hospice staff to safely dispose of controlled substances when a patient dies
text:
She’s proud to back a new bipartisan plan to:

1. support local and statewide prevention efforts 
2. improve detection and seizures of illegal shipments of fentanyl 
3. allow hospice staff to safely dispose of controlled substances when a patient dies

RULES:

 Each Round will last for 30 minutes
 The winners from each Round will advance to the next Round
 Only votes cast in the Twitter polls will be counted – replies will not be tallied
 All doggos are good doggos so please be nice
 Have fun!

html: Meet Matilda! AKA: Toodles Very deep thinker. Currently considering the fundamental nature of reality, existence, and squeaky toys. Thinks time is relative, and so are zooms. Will thoughtfully BOOP you anytime. #PuppyBowlpic.twitter.com/c8U5TYeIKj

html: Meet Buster! AKA: Good Dog “Buster came into our lives as a Christmas present for me and my sister, but turns out he only likes our mom.” – Buster’s Human. html: Meet Abner! AKA: Narf Would like to know what we’re going to do tonight, Brain? Assumes it’s the same thing we do every night: eat the kitty’s senior-blend cat food and get stuck in a tree trying to retrieve the very greatest tennis ball ever made. #PuppyBowlpic.twitter.com/yg3YbiOspn

html: #TBT: 1918 #WWI President Harry S. Truman served in the @Missouri_NG as a red leg. #DidYouKnow: Field artillery Soldiers were distinguished by scarlet stripes down the legs of their uniform pants and received the nickname "red legs." Photo courtesy of @TrumanLibrarypic.twitter.com/MySzIIDFrH
text:
#TBT: 1918 #WWI

President Harry S. Truman served in the @Missouri_NG as a red leg.

#DidYouKnow: Field artillery Soldiers were distinguished by scarlet stripes down the legs of their uniform pants and received the nickname "red legs."

Photo courtesy of @TrumanLibrarypic.twitter.com/MySzIIDFrH

html: Claire: I applaud @FEMA’s decision to allow them to get the assistance they need and I was glad to add my name to @RoyBlunt’s bill that would make this decision permanent law. I hope the Senate moves to quickly approve this bill.https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2018/01/04/in-a-shift-trump-administration-says-houses-of-worship-can-get-direct-fema-funding-after-disasters/?utm_term=.aa3b085ee31a …
text: Claire: I applaud @FEMA’s decision to allow them to get the assistance they need and I was glad to add my name to @RoyBlunt’s bill that would make this decision permanent law. I hope the Senate moves to quickly approve this bill.https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2018/01/04/in-a-shift-trump-administration-says-houses-of-worship-can-get-direct-fema-funding-after-disasters/?utm_term=.aa3b085ee31a …

html: Houses of worship are often the first places to offer critical services after a natural disaster strikes, which is why Claire is urging the Senate to pass @RoyBlunt’s & her bill that makes permanent @FEMA’s recent decision to make disaster funds available to houses of worship.pic.twitter.com/iT2ft62Pi2
text: Houses of worship are often the first places to offer critical services after a natural disaster strikes, which is why Claire is urging the Senate to pass @RoyBlunt’s & her bill that makes permanent @FEMA’s recent decision to make disaster funds available to houses of worship.pic.twitter.com/iT2ft62Pi2

text:
BREAKING—Claire issues statement in the wake of allegations against Senator Al Franken:

“I’m shocked and concerned. The behavior described is completely unacceptable. Comedy is no excuse for inappropriate conduct, and I believe there should be an ethics investigation.”
